column4: ok, i'll explain it... I need to install javadoc, and my javac isn't working very good (when I compile it at home, I get errors that I don't get in my university's computer!), what should I do about those 2 things?
what version of java are you using at home and what version does the university use?
can I PM you?
yeah
javac -showversion
javac -showversion
they say it is an invalid flag!
try java -showversion
for javadoc as far as i can remeber you only need to install ant
ok, my university has version 1-4-1-b21, I have 1.1.x-cvs from kaffe, how can I install theirs? :|
i'm not sure how you ended up with that java version but to install 1.4 try sudo apt-get install j2sdk1.4
I get this error: E: Impossvel encontrar o pacote j2sdk1.4

sorry i guess i can't really offer any more help on the subject as i am pretty new to ubuntu and not totally sure what versions of java each release has or at what repositories carry what java packages..
depends on your connection :P
you could maybe try downloading java from sun's website
to get javadoc you need ant...
sorry forgot to answer...
its there.... you use ant javadoc to generate javadoc documentation
that is the ant build file i just mentioned
not sure :P ... you could try and find some ant tutorials off google or something :P
